page.title: 19CHANGING TIMES IN PENDLESIDE
page.content: The village was quieter in days gone by with less traffic. A Fun Fair came on Good Friday till 1930's with attra- ctions big and small. From 1920-40's 1000's of hens were kept locally. Many owners were ex-mill workers. Chicks bred here were sent all over the world ( now few hens are kept). There was a toll on the Barley Road at Whitehough and one into Barley Village itself. This road along with others has since been widened. Many trees were removed as a result. A chapel at Crowtrees was taken down 10yrs ago and put into the foundations of the Bullion at Barley. The first bus in the area was an old wagon used in the week to carry coal & cleaned up at weekends for passengers. Another was known as the Covered Wagon There were more buses then. They would stop anywhere on route and carried any thing-even animals to auction!
